Please refer this student to their instructor on how they need to be accessing Pearson course material for LMS section they are in.

Resolved: 2024-09-05 09:52:22

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering A&P - This problem cannot be displayed as a test item.

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tess Walker

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: https://pearsoneducationinc.sharepoint.com/sites/GRPGPDProductResponsequestions/Lists/Higher%20Ed%20Known%20Issues%20HEKI/DispForm.aspx?ID=57 Issue This problem cannot be displayed as a test item î£¤ Customer Impact Some Mastering Platform Update users may report seeing the following error when opening an item on a text or quiz: "This problem cannot be displayed as a test item." The Mastering Content team is aware of the issue and actively working to address it. See more î£¤ Workaround As a workaround, the Mastering Content team is recommending that the course instructor recreate the assignment as a homework or remove the item from the test.

Tags: PR_FAD, PR_INFO

FAD Reason: That seem to be working as designed. Assignments can move and be part of other assignments if the due date and time are changed to match the second assignment. This does not cause an assessment to be taking twice

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, PR_RCG

Assigned to: Redouan Benayad

Resolution notes: Hi There, The course used here has been created from a retired product which is using an old technology that is no longer in use. Please ask the instructor to create a new course using the replacement product with ID: Product Name: Revel for Starting Out With Python, 6e Product ID: 5ae10b5c-bb47-4e16-ac2f-2f273a328c8d We apologize for the inconvenience, but please note that we have sent many communications since this past Spring around this course retirement.

FAD Reason: Hi There, The course used here has been created from a retired product which is using an old technology that is no longer in use. Tags: PR_FAD

Resolution notes: resolving - please assist the user

FAD Reason: SUPPORT - this is #FAD and the student must remove Screencastify from Chrome by removing the extension. Removing extensions from Chrome can be done within the Chrome browser locally. Please assist the user with local technical support troubleshooting - if you are unable to do so you might refer the student to Respondus technical support. Additional NO troubleshooting was done in 50302264 - that case is resolved because the student successfully accessed the test, I would assume after disabling the interfering application from Chrome, no action was taken by OCC since it was a local technical issue.

INC number: INC0488644

Opened: 2024-09-04 04:04:54

Resolved: 2024-09-04 11:41:46

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Economics - Missing "Match" feature on the eText Flashcard options

Assignment group: eText and Pearson Plus

Tags: FAD_EXP_act, flashcard_issue_ux, PR_PRO_eText

Assigned to: Elizabeth Ruthven

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: The user interface for the Flashcard feature has been updated and the updates will be released soon on the mobile app. What is showing on the web is what will soon be showing on the mobile app. The reason the customer is seeing the Match option on mobile app is because the mobile app is still showing the old interface. Please apologize for any inconvenience this has caused.

Please point instructor to deeplink picker / assignment deeplinking help pages for Access Pearson.

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, PR_RCG

Assigned to: Redouan Benayad

Resolution notes: Please inform the instructor that this title was retired this summer for the reason that Turnings Craft have retired their services with Pearson. We have sent multiple email notifications this past spring and summer informing instructors around this and asking them to adopt new titles our of the Pearson Catalogue which will use the new Code Grade Technology. We strongly recommend for the instructor to create a new course as none of the Turings craft assignment will work in the old courses.

FAD Reason: Please inform the instructor that this title was retired this summer for the reason that Turnings Craft have retired their services with Pearson. We have sent multiple email notifications this past spring and summer informing instructors around this and asking them to adopt new titles our of the Pearson Catalogue which will use the new Code Grade Technology. We strongly recommend for the instructor to create a new course as none of the Turings craft assignment will work in the old courses.

Case number: 50416963

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: MASTERING

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case number: 50467926

Name of agent: Floricel Blando

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: MASTERING

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

Case number: 50264421

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

INC number: INC0483251

Opened: 2024-08-29 07:07:08

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Case number: 50195850

Name of agent: Rica Aiza Cruz

Team Leader: Ronald Villa

Team: T2

Category: MASTERING

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Unfortunately, there is no clear notification within the instructorâ€™s account or course that indicates the materialâ€™s status.

INC number: INC0492391

Opened: 2024-09-07 00:22:09

Resolved: 2024-09-09 10:35:03

Product Name - Issue short description: REVEL - ERROR: An unknown server error has occurred. Please try again

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, PR_RCG

Assigned to: Redouan Benayad

We apologize for the inconvenience but please note that our marketing team have sent many communications since early Spring around this retirement and updated on the new replacement products using the new Code Grade technology

Case number: 50395448

Name of agent: Mary Joyce Pablo

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: MASTERING

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Work with the instructor to advise on this XL functionality, removing the 'omit' option will allow grades to flow.

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Resolved: 2024-08-29 00:17:15

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Case number: 50536556

Name of agent: Melissa Krathwohl

Team: T3

Category: MASTERING

INC number: INC0499511

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Case number: 50558734

Name of agent: Michael Pan

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: MASTERING

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_GS, lms_grade_sync, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Upeka Dissanayake

Resolution notes: This course is using Access Pearson Codeless so assignment deeplinks are not being created in "MyLab & Mastering Assignments" folder (this was experience for legacy Partner Integration this university was using previous year). Please point instructor to deeplink picker / assignment deeplinking help pages for Access Pearson.

Case number: 50416963

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: MMND

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case number: 50467926

Name of agent: Floricel Blando

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: MMND

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

INC number: INC0483251

Opened: 2024-08-29 07:07:08

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Case number: 50195850

Name of agent: Rica Aiza Cruz

Team Leader: Ronald Villa

Team: T2

Category: MMND

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Case number: 50395448

Name of agent: Mary Joyce Pablo

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: MMND

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

Assignment group: XL Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tess Walker

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: As you know XL does not keep nor can we provide "activity reports" As you also know XL logs student work in real time, with protections against loss of work in triplicate Barring the unlikely event that the result was deleted by the instructor, which clearly doesn't seem to be the case here, this student never completed any work on these assignments as is reflected in the Gradebook. This is #FAD

Assignment group: eText and Pearson Plus

Tags: FAD_EXP_act, title_miss_ux

Assigned to: Elizabeth Ruthven

Resolution notes: Revel Teaching Primary Mathematics, 6e Australia version Product ID: 08f51bfb-8ffe-4c12-ad72-9804e8f8d218 This product is not a Pearson+ title therefore it is not expected to be available in the Pearson+ library. This is courseware (Revel) and requires the course to be created in Console (console.pearson.com) and to be accessed through Console. The user will need to log in to console.pearson.com, select create course, select their institution to see the materials available to create the course.

INC number: INC0482479

Opened: 2024-08-28 19:27:00

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Anatomy & Physiology - Launch failed for one of the following reasons error when clicking the assignment links

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.1, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - standard XL functionality for assignment/grade syncs. In XL, you have to have the assignment set to sync in Gradebook > sync settings (which the assignment is) AND not set to Omit in Change Weights, which is not done for this assignment.

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Case number: 50536556

Name of agent: Melissa Krathwohl

Team: T3

Category: MMND

INC number: INC0499511

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Case number: 50558734

Name of agent: Michael Pan

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: MMND

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.

Case number: 50223008

Name of agent: Andy Cook

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: MMND

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Unable to update institution

Assignment group: XL Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Bryan Huffman

Resolution notes: This is not a technical error - the school is applied to the instructors account based on what they've entered during registration. This can also be updated by you within the XL Admin tool if they do not have the proper school listed on their account. Instructors can also use the Change option to select a different school if the course they are looking for does not show up. The fact that there are variances in the school names - will need to be addressed locally to ensure the users all select the same school to share their assignments. We have updated the list provided to Beverly Public School District - so all the users should see each others courses when selecting that option.

Case number: 50416963

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: REVEL

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case number: 50467926

Name of agent: Floricel Blando

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: REVEL

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

INC number: INC0483251

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Case number: 50195850

Name of agent: Rica Aiza Cruz

Team Leader: Ronald Villa

Team: T2

Category: REVEL

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Case number: 50395448

Name of agent: Mary Joyce Pablo

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: REVEL

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

Case number: 50263449

Name of agent: Ivette Silva

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: REVEL

INC number: INC0482591

Opened: 2024-08-28 20:16:49

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: This is XL functionality; If the assignment is set to 'Omit' in gradebook > Change Weights and Categories it will NOT be sent to the LMS. I just checked the course and XL course and all assignments are set to 'Omit', therefore they will not be sent to the LMS. Work with the instructor to advise on this XL functionality, removing the 'omit' option will allow grades to flow.

The assignments are only set to be available 2 weeks before the due date.

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Resolved: 2024-08-29 00:17:15

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Case number: 50536556

Name of agent: Melissa Krathwohl

Team: T3

Category: REVEL

INC number: INC0499511

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Case number: 50558734

Name of agent: Michael Pan

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: REVEL

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.

FAD Reason: https://pearsoneducationinc.sharepoint.com/sites/GRPGPDProductResponsequestions/Lists/Higher%20Ed%20Known%20Issues%20HEKI/DispForm.aspx?ID=57 Issue This problem cannot be displayed as a test item î£¤ Customer Impact Some Mastering Platform Update users may report seeing the following error when opening an item on a text or quiz: "This problem cannot be displayed as a test item." The Mastering Content team is aware of the issue and actively working to address it. See more î£¤ Workaround As a workaround, the Mastering Content team is recommending that the course instructor recreate the assignment as a homework or remove the item from the test.

Case number: 50416963

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: XL

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case number: 50467926

Name of agent: Floricel Blando

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: XL

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

INC number: INC0483251

Opened: 2024-08-29 07:07:08

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Case number: 50195850

Name of agent: Rica Aiza Cruz

Team Leader: Ronald Villa

Team: T2

Category: XL

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Case number: 50395448

Name of agent: Mary Joyce Pablo

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: XL

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. INC number: INC0482591

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

I just checked the course and XL course and all assignments are set to 'Omit', therefore they will not be sent to the LMS. Work with the instructor to advise on this XL functionality, removing the 'omit' option will allow grades to flow.

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Resolved: 2024-08-29 00:17:15

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Case number: 50536556

Name of agent: Melissa Krathwohl

Team: T3

Category: XL

INC number: INC0499511

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Case number: 50558734

Name of agent: Michael Pan

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: XL

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.

Case number: 50416963

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: REGISTRATION

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case number: 50467926

Name of agent: Floricel Blando

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: REGISTRATION

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

INC number: INC0483251

Opened: 2024-08-29 07:07:08

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Case number: 50195850

Name of agent: Rica Aiza Cruz

Team Leader: Ronald Villa

Team: T2

Category: REGISTRATION

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Case number: 50395448

Name of agent: Mary Joyce Pablo

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: REGISTRATION

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

Case number: 50263449

Name of agent: Ivette Silva

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: REGISTRATION

INC number: INC0482591

Opened: 2024-08-28 20:16:49

Resolved: 2024-08-29 10:36:11

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - We could not find any Pearson MyLab & Mastering assignments to sync with your course."

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: This is XL functionality; If the assignment is set to 'Omit' in gradebook > Change Weights and Categories it will NOT be sent to the LMS. I just checked the course and XL course and all assignments are set to 'Omit', therefore they will not be sent to the LMS. Work with the instructor to advise on this XL functionality, removing the 'omit' option will allow grades to flow.

Resolution notes: PR FAD: The code: IBRA-THUN-KPIL-CHFL-YTEE-LVIS is not working, because there is no such code in our system (doesn't show in support dashboard). It looks like they took the code from the case description and removed some letters to try and make it work, but that's not going to work. The code showing in the description of the ticket is: IBRA-THUNK-PILCH-FLYTE-ELVIS-GIBES which is an old access code for standalone eText which we don't offer anymore. This code can only be used for instructor led eText, but that requires an invite link from their instructor to redeem the code.

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Resolved: 2024-08-29 00:17:15

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Case number: 50536556

Name of agent: Melissa Krathwohl

Team: T3

Category: REGISTRATION

INC number: INC0499511

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Case number: 50558734

Name of agent: Michael Pan

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Category: REGISTRATION

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.

Case number: N/A

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: PEARSON+

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

Case Number: 50416963

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case number: N/A

Name of agent: Floricel Blando

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: PEARSON+

Case Number: 50467926

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

Case Number: 50264421

INC number: INC0483251

Opened: 2024-08-29 07:07:08

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Resolution notes: Please inform the instructor that this title was retired this summer for the reason that Turnings Craft have retired their services with Pearson. We have sent multiple email notifications this past spring and summer informing instructors around this and asking them to adopt new titles out of the Pearson Catalogue which are using the new Code Grade Technology. We strongly recommend for the instructor to create a new course as none of the Turings craft assignment will work in the old courses.

FAD Reason: Please inform the instructor that this title was retired this summer for the reason that Turnings Craft have retired their services with Pearson. Category: PEARSON+

Case Number: 50195850

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Case Number: 50395448

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. Resolution notes: Support, We don't provide replacement codes that is something you should be doing. I am closing this case. If there is an issue please be specific about what the issue is. This is FAD.

Case Number: 50263151

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Resolved: 2024-08-29 00:17:15

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Case Number: 50536556

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Case Number: 50558734

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.

Opened: 2024-09-23 10:39:31

Product Name - Issue short description: MathXL for School - Missing student's grade

Assignment group: XL Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tess Walker

Resolution notes: SUPPORT - this is #FAD - students in MathXL Standalone can only be enrolled in one course at a time, but they can enroll in a new course at any time. You can assist the educator here because there isn't any need to escalate - here's how! 1) have the student enroll in the PREVIOUS section 2) once they have- the EDU can EXPORT the results 3) Once the export is complete have the student enroll in the NEW section If the COURSES match exactly they can also use the IMPORT options to import the result. Please assist the educator.

INC number: INC0510407

Opened: 2024-09-26 11:21:06

Resolved: 2024-09-26 23:49:28

Product Name - Issue short description: REVEL- Chapter quiz set to unlimited tries but some students has 3 attempts only

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Steven Comar

Resolution notes: Support this is FAD. This is straight from the help file so please make sure you're doing your due diligence before sending something up to engineering. https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=revel-glp-instructor&topicId=Content/6-settings/how-settings-work.htm&_LANG=enus Unlimited tries If your course includes questions, such as code questions, with an unlimited number of possible answers, and you select the Unlimited tries option, students can answer the question as many times as they choose. If, however, you select unlimited tries for assessments with questions that have a set number of answers, Revel limits the tries to the number of answers minus 1, as described above.

Category: Additional FAD cases

Case number: 50627637

Agent: Lisa Marie Cantoria

INC number: INC0508790

Opened: 2024-09-24 23:33:52

Resolved: 2024-09-25 01:00:46

Product Name - Issue short description: Mylab Statistics- Cannot delete assignment/Edit Assignment

Assignment group: XL Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Bryan Huffman

Resolution notes: CTS - The assignment cannot be deleted because there are results associated with the assignment in the course titled MATH 217 Summer 2024. If these scores have been exported or are no longer needed - you can delete the results for this assignment within this course - and that will allow the full assignment to be removed. In regards to the Learning Aid changes - these can only be changed on assignments that students have not started. If there are current scores for these assignments - they would need to be deleted as well - the Learning Aids can then be updated - and then students can rework the assignment. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Category: Additional FAD cases

Case number: 50723660

Agent: Veronica Cavara

INC number: INC0518679

Opened: 2024-10-04 06:03:08

Resolved: 2024-10-04 23:22:20

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Biology - Student Late Penalty

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: incorrect_score, MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: This is expected behavior in Mastering Platform Update. The original due date for the assignment was September 24th; however, the instructor applied individual student settings to the assignment (I suspect after the student completed it) to give this student a due date October 3rd. Unlike legacy Mastering, Mastering Platform Update does not automatically regrade student submissions when a new due date is applied. For the new settings to apply to the student's submission, the student needs to reopen the assignment. Since the new due date has passed, the instructor will need to push it out to any time in the future, and then the student will need to reopen and save the assignment before the new due date passes.

Category: Additional FAD cases

Case Number: 50474536

INC number: INC0493818

Opened: 2024-09-09 17:07:07

Resolved: 2024-09-10 16:11:24

Product Name - Issue short description: Grade sync issue with Canvas and Revel Canvas is marking students late when they are not, time zone is correct

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: 3PL_CP, 3PL_GS, 3PL_INFO, lms_grade_sync, PR_APC

Assigned to: Steven Comar

Resolution notes: Hi Melissa, Now that Auto Grade sync is turned on this should let the grades sync right when they are completed by the student and should also stop these "false" late submissions that are only showing on the Canvas side as the grade is showing up correctly on the Revel side. Unfortunately to my knowledge there is no way to retroactively fix the Canvas gradebook but that would be a question for the school Canvas admin or Canvas support. If this is still happening on future assignments that haven't been completed yet and the grades sync automatically please give us one student and the exercise so that we can look into this. The Revel and Learning Management System team are aware that submission time aren't sent to the LMS and the sync time is what is view by the Learning Management System as the "submit time" and can cause this issue. Unfortunately I do not have an ETA on when this will be changed but it is something the teams are working diligently on.

Missing Info: #INFO - for grade sync issues, we need specifics; I.E. student and assignment that is marked as late in the LMS. otherwise it is very easy to miss the issue completely.

Category: INFO

Case number: N/A

Name of Agent: Melissa Krathwohl

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Tags: PR_INFO, XL_NI

Assigned to: Bryan Huffman

Resolution notes: CTS - There was not a specific assignment title offered in this case. The student shows they have two instructor provided 0's in the gradebook. For both of these assignments - if you review the Item Analysis - you can see the student did not attempt any of the questions within either assignment. When the instructor ran the manage incomplete functionality - the assignment was given a 0. If the student attempted to work on these after the 0 was provided - it would have been in review mode and nothing would have been logged as the score was already provided. Thanks Bryan

The Mastering Content team is aware of the issue and actively working to address it. Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, PR_RCG

Assigned to: Redouan Benayad

FAD Reason.: Please inform the instructor that this title was retired this summer for the reason that Turnings Craft have retired their services with Pearson. We have sent multiple email notifications this past spring and summer informing instructors around this and asking them to adopt new titles our of the Pearson Catalogue which will use the new Code Grade Technology. We strongly recommend for the instructor to create a new course as none of the Turings craft assignment will work in the old courses.

Category: Team Frez HETS INFO_FAD Aug19to

Case number: N/A

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: Team Frez HETS INFO_FAD Aug19to

Questions/Comments/Notes to raise on CTS/Prod Support Call: We understand that this is FAD. This case originated from FS, where the FS team and FS Specialist explained to the EDU that students receive a score of zero due to the settings applied to the assignments, even though they have not completed them yet. Despite this explanation, the EDU insisted that there are some technical issues with the assignments or gradebook. As a result, the FS team decided to escalate the case to TS as the FS Specialist mentioned that they have seen similar case escalated to TS. From the Tier 2 side, we've reviewed the support site before I escalate the case, though I was not able to mention that the EDU needs to uncheck the box each time they manage incompletes and point out that the EDU has the option to delete the zero scores. But we were able to inform the EDU that this is working as designed. We also provided the support site - https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm to the instructor for review; however, the EDU continues to insist that there is something wrong with their gradebook and assignment settings that is why we decided to escalate the case for further review.

Case Number: 50416963

INC number: INC0492379

Opened: 2024-09-06 21:22:32

Resolved: 2024-09-09 13:19:49

Product Name - Issue short description: Mastering Genetics - Submit zeros for students who did not start the assignment/Manage Incompletes

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Closed

FAD Reason.: This is functioning as designed. The box needs to be unchecked each time the instructor manages incompletes: https://help.pearsoncmg.com/xl/instructor/instructor_help/Content/submit_scores_incompletes.htm. If they would like to delete 0 scores that they did not mean to give to specific students, they can click on those scores in the gradebook, select the dropdown next to the assignment on the next page, and delete the 0 score. However, please caution them that deleting is permanent; therefore, they want to be careful when doing this to avoid deleting any actual scores.

Case Number: 50467926

INC number: INC0495929

Opened: 2024-09-11 17:59:55

Product Name - Issue short description: Revel - Total points not changing even after editing the Global settings

Assignment group: Revel Product Escalations

Tags: PR_FAD, Scoring_Policy

Assigned to: Jena Subrat

Resolution notes: This is FAD. The locked scoring policy for the assignment was set to 0. Once a student starts the assessment that scoring policy can not be changed. Changing the Global Scoring policy only makes changes to items that have not been engaged by a student and locked. To view the scoring policy you can edit the assignment > click the 3 dots next to the assessment > click view scoring policy.

Category: Team Frez HETS INFO_FAD Aug19to

Case number: N/A

Name of agent: Christopher Bustamante

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Team: T2

Category: Team Frez HETS INFO_FAD Aug19to

Case Number: 50264421

INC number: INC0483251

Opened: 2024-08-29 07:07:08

Resolved: 2024-09-02 09:08:17

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics - SOCKET_RP_68

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_RP_68

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - For training to remind agents to review documents "OneCRM KB 11507 has information on SOCKET_RP_68 where it is mentioned that this occurs when a user attempts to crossover to Pearson content via LTI 1.3 integration via a deeplink before the course pairing has been done. The workaround is "Instructors should be advised to add the LTI 1.3 Pearson link to the LMS course and pair the course; not through the deeplink"

Case Number: 50195850

INC number: INC0475294

Opened: 2024-08-21 10:49:53

Resolved: 2024-08-21 12:56:40

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Math - Grades not syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: #FAD - assignments are set to 'omit results' in XL course, so are not sent to LMS. In XL, there are two settings that control the sending of assignments and grades to the LMS, 1) Grade Sync Settings - This is where the instructor can set to sync grades to the LMS 2) Change Weights and Categories - Any assignments set to 'omit' will not send to the LMS. Please make sure you are checking both these locations in your investigation.

Category: Team Frez HETS INFO_FAD Aug19to

Case number: N/A

Name of agent: Kenneth Arvin Garcia

Team Leader: Frezalin Bascara

Case Number: 50395448

INC number: INC0491170

Opened: 2024-09-05 19:38:36

Resolved: 2024-09-09 01:16:10

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Statistics- SOCKET_IM_12

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_FAD, SOCKET_IM_12

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. CTS agent should be able to check this with student on call, if further training is needed please advise.

FAD Reason.: Please reach out to the DOM for the institution to confirm how this course should be setup and the access these students should have. #FAD - As per OneCRM KB - 000011507, the SOCKET_IM_12 error will generally occur if the LMS course is paired to a retail course (via Access Pearson) and the user is trying to launch it from a channel partner (VitalSource, Redshelf, WilloLab, Barnes and Noble, etc) tool, which is what is happening here from launch logs. Case Number: 50263151

INC number: INC0481813

Opened: 2024-08-28 04:03:11

Resolved: 2024-08-29 00:17:15

Product Name - Issue short description: MyLab Accounting - Grades not showing in D2L

Assignment group: Digital Integration Services

Tags: PR_FAD

Assigned to: Justin Squiers

Resolution notes: The issue here is the instructor has almost all items marked as "Omit Results". This is causing the sync to D2L to fail. Once the Omit Results is turned off those items will flow into the "Instructor Self-Service" link area > Grade Sync where sync can then be confirmed for all items. Once the graded items flow to the ISS > Grade Sync area, and the applicable items have been marked for sync and they read "Enabled", those will then appear in the D2L gradebook. Please reopen if this does not resolve the grade sync issues. Omit Results items are found in the MyLab Gradebook > Change Weights area...

Resolution notes: This is functioning as designed. The instructor has the Course Home set to "hidden." Please reach out to the instructor directly and let them know that students are not able to access the Course Home when they open the course because it has been set to hidden. I'm not sure if they intended to do this or if it was an accident, but they can unhide it by going to Manage course>Edit Course Menu> and clicking the toggle.

Case Number: 50536556

INC number: INC0499511

Opened: 2024-09-16 02:16:11

Resolved: 2024-09-17 11:23:14

Product Name - Issue short description: Assignments Not Syncing

Assignment group: 3PL Product Escalation

Tags: 3PL_1.3, 3PL_FAD, 3PL_GS

Assigned to: Ben Lethlean

Resolution notes: I can see that the mentioned assignments are listed as "status" : "RECEIVED" in the lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB, which means they have yet to be synced to the LMS. The lineItemContainer collection in SOCKET DB is where all assignments are stored with the relevant information. As this still has "status" : "RECEIVED", meaning it hasn't been delivered, I checked the gradeSetting collection; which has the sync details, and can see that this is set to automatic, but specific assignments. The list doesn't include the assignments they have mentioned are missing from the LMS gradebook. Please work with the instructor to select the assignments they wish to sync from the instructor dashboard > grade sync tab and then run the manual grade sync.

Team Leader: T3 TL

Team: T3

Case Number: 50558734

INC number: INC0500673

Opened: 2024-09-17 01:49:56

Resolved: 2024-09-17 04:17:09

Product Name - Issue short description: MPU - Interactive Reading and DSM assigment (attempts not working)

Assignment group: Mastering Product Escalations

Tags: MX_MPU, PR_FAD

Assigned to: Tana Regan

Resolution notes: Hi Michael, It sounds like there is some confusion between tries and attempts here. The students are getting two tries and 10 attempts. Each time they click the check answer or final check button, that counts as a try. When they click try again, that counts as a new attempt, so they get two tries to answer the questions with each of the 10 attempts the instructor has provided. You can learn more by reviewing this help file: https://support.pearson.com/getsupport/s/document-item?bundleId=Tries-vs-attempts-in-MyLab-and-Mastering&topicId=Tries_vs_Attempts.html&_LANG=enus.
